meanings.sent1: Last winter, we got stuck in a snowstorm while driving home.
meanings.sent2: The town was covered in white after the snowstorm passed through.
meanings.sent3: The kids were thrilled to have a snow day due to the unexpected snowstorm.
meanings.sent4: The snowstorm painted the landscape in a blanket of white, like a giant snow globe.
meanings.sent5: The howling winds of the snowstorm made it feel like nature's icy wrath.

meanings.definition: To be caught in a snowstorm.
meanings.sent1: I hope we don't get snowstormed while hiking in the mountains.
meanings.sent2: If you get snowstormed, find shelter and wait for it to pass.
meanings.sent3: We were snowstormed on our camping trip, but it turned into a fun adventure.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected meeting snowstormed our plans for the weekend.
meanings.sent5: The blizzard snowstormed the city, causing chaos on the roads.

meanings.definition: Snowstorms are common in the winter.
meanings.sent1: People prepare for snowstorms by stocking up on supplies like food and blankets.
meanings.sent2: In some regions, snowstorms are a regular occurrence during the colder months.
meanings.sent3: The snowstorms in this area are so predictable, they even have a snow day schedule.
meanings.sent4: The news warned of an incoming snowstorm, urging everyone to stay indoors.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of snowstorms lies in the way they transform the world into a winter wonderland.
